Package via.sep3.group11.tier2.shared.domain

Class ValidationHelper

java.lang.Object
via.sep3.group11.tier2.shared.domain.ValidationHelper
public class ValidationHelper extends Object
Helper class used to validate various values.
Version:
27/11-2022
Author:
Christian Hougaard Pedersen

    • ValidationHelper

      public ValidationHelper()

  • Method Details

    • ValidateFirstName

      protected static void ValidateFirstName(String firstName) throws ValidationException
      Method used for validating a string representing a first name. Validation is done by calling the SimpleValidateString-method with the parameter, and the parameter name.
      Parameters:
      firstName - : The value to be validated.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the SimpleValidateString-method throws an exception.

    • ValidateLastName

      protected static void ValidateLastName(String lastName) throws ValidationException
      Method used for validating a string representing a last name. Validation is done by calling the SimpleValidateString-method with the parameter, and the parameter name.
      Parameters:
      lastName - : The value to be validated.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the SimpleValidateString-method throws an exception.

    • ValidateMiddleName

      protected static String ValidateMiddleName(Optional<String> middleName) throws ValidationException
      Method used for validating an optional string representing a middle name. If the parameter has content, a check is made to make sure that it is not an empty string. If the parameter is empty, the method returns an empty string.
      Parameters:
      middleName - : The optional value to set the middle name to.
      Returns:
      The string value to assign to the middlename of the calling object.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if parameter contains an empty string.

    • ValidateEmail

      protected static void ValidateEmail(String email) throws ValidationException
      Method used for validating a string representing an email address. Validation is done by calling the SimpleValidateString-method with the parameter, and the parameter name. After this, it is verified that the email contains a dot(.) and an at(@).
      Parameters:
      email - : The value to be validated.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the SimpleValidateString-method throws an exception or if the email does not contain . or @.

    • ValidatePassword

      protected static void ValidatePassword(String password) throws ValidationException
      Method used for validating a string representing a password. Validation is done by calling the SimpleValidateString-method with the parameter, and the parameter name.
      Parameters:
      password - : The value to be validated.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the SimpleValidateString-method throws an exception.

    • ValidateNationality

      protected static void ValidateNationality(String nationality) throws ValidationException
      Method used for validating a string representing a nationality. Validation is done by calling the SimpleValidateString-method with the parameter, and the parameter name.
      Parameters:
      nationality - : The value to be validated.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the SimpleValidateString-method throws an exception.

    • ValidateGender

      protected static char ValidateGender(char gender) throws ValidationException
      Method used for validating and returning a char representing a gender.
      Parameters:
      gender - The char to validate
      Returns:
      the char representation of the gender to be assigned to the calling object.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if parameter is not M/m, F/f or O/o.

    • SimpleValidateString

      protected static void SimpleValidateString(String toValidate, String paramName) throws ValidationException
      Simple validation method used to verify that a String has content.
      Parameters:
      toValidate - : The string to validate.
      paramName - : The name of the parameter from the calling method.
      Throws:
      ValidationException - if the toValidate parameter is null or an empty string.
